moves.1. e4: This one saw me wrap up my 1400th win on the best chess site. GameKnot. Bearwits, thank you ! Standard e4, c5. d3, Nc6 opening. My c5 reply I feel gives me options !
moves.1... c5: The Sicilian defence a fav of many former great players. Myself who is a massive fan of it.
moves.2. d3 Nc6 3. Nf3 d6 4. Be2 g6: I think this is called fianchetto, perhaps those of superior chess knowledge will comment. Any's having the dark squared bishop here is threatening.
moves.5. O-O Bg7 6. c3 e6 7. h3 Nge7: Nge7 supports nc6, getting the Knights working together can be deadly !
moves.8. Bd2 O-O 9. a3 Qb6: Qb6 ?? Thought so myself on reflection. Leaves d6 hanging, do I have a plan ?
moves.10. b4 cxb4 11. axb4: Nxb4 ! White can't take or Bxa1, leading to an advantage in piece material.
moves.14... Re8: Re1 ! Having my Rook pinned doesn't benefit me !
moves.15. Nh2 b6 16. f4 Bb7: Bb7 ! Both bishops playing a role from afar !
moves.17. Qa3: Qa3 ?? Move baffled me as does this help white's momentum ?
moves.17... Red8 18. Rac1 b5: b5, that Knight was bugging me. Also saw an opportunity for a possible two passed pawns. Was I already getting greedy. With the Bishop on g7. White's queenside is looking vacant !
moves.19. Ne3 a5 20. d4 Qb6: White has to bring a piece over on queenside !
moves.21... Ba6: I'd say time to launch an attack on one of them hanging pieces. I'm sure it say's in books, protect your pieces at all times ??
moves.22... Qc7 23. Ne3 b4: b4 weaken's white's centre (attack's the White Queen, although those three musketeers are battle hardened. Open's the door for Bxe2
moves.24. Qb3 Bxe2: Piece advantage ! Bd3 coming right up !
moves.25. Rfe1 Bd3 26. Rbc1 Bxe4: Now the threat of white's rook on the e file ain't much of a threat.
moves.27. Neg4 a4 28. Qc4 Bd5 29. Qf1: b3 leads to c4 ! light squared bishop then has limited options, I feel.
moves.29... bxc3 30. Bxc3 Nf5: There's a possible pin that I'm aware of. Rc1 on knc6, so that stays put. kne7 tof5 ! Double pronged attack. e6 ! & h4, threatens g2. I'm sure white is feeling somewhat pressurised.
moves.31. Nf3 a3 32. Rca1 Bxf3: Ganging up on a piece at times is a smokescreen !
moves.34... Qb6: Missed move on my part ! Or not ! Checkmate is a possiblity with my two warrior knights !
moves.35. Qf2 Ne2+: At this point white resigns. As kn(5)g3 leads to significant damage to whites cause.
